Title: What Blood Groups Do Mosquitoes Have?
Article:
Human beings have different blood groups. No matter what the blood group, mosquitoes have every chance to feast on human blood. But surprisingly, mosquitoes do not have any blood groups of their own! In fact they do not have any blood at all!
Mosquitoes do have body fluids, but it’s not blood. It’s usually called Hemolymph. Hemolymph is different from human blood because it doesn’t have red blood cells in it. This absence makes a huge difference, because red blood cells determine blood groups of human beings. In short mosquitoes neither have blood nor blood groups!!!
